isis.stitle: Spanish - Guía para Localización de Fallas del Sistema Eléctrico - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD MODEL 292, 392, 492 - DISASSEMBLE - FIXED MITER

svcproc.title: FIXED MITER
svcproc.para: Make reference marks on the miter cover and the miter housing to aid in re-alignment during assembly.

step1.para: Remove the lube fitting and four bolts and lockwashers from the miter shaft cover ( Figure 58).

figure.caption: Figure 58. Remove Lube Fitting, Bolts and Lockwashers From Miter Shaft Cover

step1.para: Carefully turn and pull miter shaft and cover from the miter housing ( Figure 59).

figure.caption: Figure 59. Pull Miter Shaft and Cover From Miter Housing

step1.para: Drive roll pin from miter gear and pull gear off miter shaft. Remove shims/gaskets and lay aside ( Figure 60).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Pull Gear Off Miter Shaft

step1.para: Pry locating pin out of the bearing retainer ring and pull from the cover ( Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Pull Locating Pin From Cover

step1.para: Turn bearing retainer counterclockwise to remove from the cover. Tap the miter shaft and bearing out of the miter cover ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Tap Miter Shaft and Bearing Out of Miter Cover

step1.para: Remove the seal from the miter cover ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Remove Seal From Miter Cover

step1.para: Carefully tap or press miter shaft out of the bearing ( Figure 64).

figure.caption: Figure 64. Press Miter Shaft Out of Bearing

step1.para: Remove the miter housing from the bearing cap by removing the bolts and lockwashers which pass through the miter housing. Two bolts and lockwashers are located inside the miter housing and must be removed before the housing can be separated from the bearing cap ( Figure 65).

figure.caption: Figure 65. Remove Miter Housing From Bearing Cap

step1.para: Carefully turn and with a soft hammer tap the housing off the bearing cap ( Figure 66).

figure.caption: Figure 66. Tap Housing Off Bearing Cap

step1.para: Remove the O-ring seal and the self-locking nut and washer from the actuating shaft, and remove the miter gear from the shaft ( Figure 67).

figure.caption: Figure 67. Remove Miter Gear From Shaft

step1.para: Mark the bearing cap and bearing retainer to indicate the locking pin hole location and remove the retainer locking pin ( Figure 68).
Remove bearing retaining nut from the bearing cap ( Figure 69).
Remove the shims, laying on top of the bearing and lay aside for re-use ( Figure 70).
Remove remaining bolts and lockwasher attaching the bearing cap to the steering gear housing. Turn the actuating shaft and bearing cap out of the steering gear ( Figure 71).

figure.caption: Figure 71. Remove Bolts and Lockwasher Attaching Bearing Cap to Steering Gear Housing
Figure 72. Press Actuating Shaft and Bearing Out of Bearing Cap

step1.para: If the fixed plunger in the bearing cap is damaged, it can be removed by pulling out the locking pin and pulling the plunger out of the bearing cap ( Figure 73).

figure.caption: Figure 73. Remove Fixed Plunger if Damaged

step1.para: Tap the high pressure actuating shaft seal out of the bearing cap if replacement is required ( Figure 74).

figure.caption: Figure 74. Tap High Pressure Actuating Shaft Seal Out of Bearing Cap
